It perks up everything here, and frankly, just about anything you grill.IngredientsMakes about 2 cups1oz. red Thai chiles (about 20)6garlic cloves1scallion, white and pale green parts only1½cups cane vinegar (such as Datu Puti) or unseasoned rice vinegar1Tbsp. kosher salt1tsp. black peppercorns2tsp. sugar½small red onion, finely choppedPreparationStep 1Blend chiles, garlic, scallion, vinegar, salt, peppercorns, and sugar in a blender until finely chopped. Transfer to a nonreactive bowl and mix in onion.Step 2Do Ahead: Vinegar can be made 2 months ahead.
